pr_info.title: Add memory and resource limits as specified in Section 5.2
pr_info.author: code-developer

suggestions.title: Missing direct memory limit calls in other symbolic functions
suggestions.description: logic_find_path_to_exception and logic_compare_functions don't call set_memory_limit() directly, though they get memory protection through SymbolicAnalyzer
suggestions.fix: Consider adding set_memory_limit() calls to all symbolic execution functions for consistency
suggestions.impact: Minor consistency issue, no functional impact

excellent_patterns.description: Perfect implementation of exact specification with 2GB soft limit and unlimited hard limit
Cross-platform memory usage monitoring with detailed reporting in results
excellent_patterns.why_excellent: Handles macOS (KB) vs Linux (bytes) conversion and provides complete memory analytics

excellent_patterns.description: Extensive test suite covering all aspects of memory limits and resource management
excellent_patterns.why_excellent: 15+ tests covering exact specification, cross-platform compatibility, error handling, and integration

security_posture.improvements: Prevents Z3 solver memory exhaustion attacks

short_term_improvements: Consider adding set_memory_limit() calls to all symbolic functions for consistency
Add memory monitoring to other functions if detailed analytics needed

learning_opportunity: Task 8 demonstrates perfect specification compliance with exact implementation of Section 5.2 memory limits. The implementation correctly uses resource.setrlimit(resource.RLIMIT_AS, (2 * 1024 * 1024 * 1024, -1)) for 2GB soft limit with unlimited hard limit. Cross-platform memory monitoring provides operational visibility while preventing Z3 solver memory exhaustion attacks. This shows how exact specification implementation can achieve both security and operational goals without impacting performance.
